basics.name: Ellen Hughes
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Mathematics in the Mathematics Department at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Summer, 2024.

work.summary: Assisted students in recitation for Survey of Mathematics (MATH 100) in Fall of 2023 and Calculus 2 (MATH 242) in the Spring of 2024.
highlights: Answered questions during recition, held office hours, and graded worksheets

work.summary: Student assistant in the daily operations of Research Information Services
highlights: Assisted in cross checking item lists in the East West Center library and Alma catalog and removed books from the collection. Shelved books and filed library materials.
Created a digital finding guide for the Arts Program Archive. Prepared collections to be archived.
Assisted in archiving the Jon Van Dyke, William S. Richardson, and Aviam Soifer collections under the supervision of Dr. Ellen Rae-Cachola.
Assisted library patrons at the circulation desk and answered calls. Shelved books and periodicals. Familiar with micro-film storage procedure and have experienc working in libguides
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

grants.title: Context-free grammars for English and Hawaiian phonology
grants.awarder: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program, University of Hawai‘i
grants.summary: Received a grant of $2,920. Researched Hawaiian stress assignments and syllables using edit distances and context free grammars under the direction of Professor Bjørn Kjos-Hanssen.
